file_content.text: If the canisters were damaged, the bospridium gas will eat both flesh and circuits. You understand, my toy?
Canister damage + bospridium = class-three hazard
Yes. Now clean it up! And incinerate the bodies--they're contaminated now.
Administrator Kroius?
I'm here to inspect your security; I'll need full access and samples of these chemicals.
I see. I wish you'd given me a few days' notice--this is a very delicate operation.
Yes, the Intelligence operative. Control informed me of your situation; I wish you'd told me in advance.
Do you have the compounds I need?
Give me my chemicals, please.
Did you say "Incinerate the bodies"?
You mentioned a toxic spill...
Incompetent workforce. I ran Graag the Hutt's spice warehousing on Kessel, and it was no better then.
Imperial Intelligence doesn't work at your convenience.
Watch your tone.
That is quite clear to me.
Oh-seven--fetch! Now!
You'll have your samples presently. Unfortunately, I'm out of dimalium-6. The Republic seized that chem-mine some time ago, and their transports are under guard.
I'll need maps and anything you have on their security.
I'll handle it myself.
You have seen the Republic forces? Snipers, battle drones...? Not that it matters to me.
Any alternative chemicals?
Is there a substitute?
Not that I've ever used. Nor the Republic, if they're so intent on keeping Chem-Mine Delta.
Your only job is to supply the Empire with chemicals. And you can't even do that.
That's no excuse for failure.
Blame your Moff. Or pay a visit to Chem-Mine Delta yourself.
I've done my best to sate your people's appetites for hallucinogenic tea, mind-eaters or what-have-you. I'd think you'd appreciate it.
He is the chemical supplier. He helped them change you.
Are you going to let him continue his work?
Are you going to let him go unpunished?
Operative?
What do you think Intelligence does with your chemicals?
Do you know how it's all used?
Oh, I couldn't guess. Dimalium-6 enhances spice, distorts memory, corrupts mood...
Your help is appreciated, administrator.
That'll suffice, thank you.
You have no idea the damage you've done.
You disgusting leech.
I'm afraid I don't understand.
One blaster shot. Spilled chemicals. An explosion. No evidence of murder.
Make him pay, if you like.
Please--my relationship with Intelligence has profited us all.
Ours has always been a profitable relationship. I have no desire to disturb that.
We're finished, administrator. You won't see me again.
Time for me to go.
Very well. I must return to my work.
The dimalium-6 operations are over. You no longer supply it for the Empire.
No more dimalium, understand?
That isn't... my decision to make. But I'll do my best to comply.
You've changed nothing. Only slowed it awhile.
Let me guess. Next step--assault a Republic chemical transport.
If we understand correctly, we're going after a Republic mining transport. The conflict never seems to end.
He mentioned a Republic mining transport. I assume that's our next target.
To the mining transport, I take it? For this mystery chemical of yours....
I could do much worse to you. Consider this a mercy.
You deserve death. [Kill him]
Defensive systems = online
I sure hope you're planning to explain this someday....
This is not harmony, agent. We're certain of that.
You're scaring me a little, sir....
I do wonder what goes through your head, Cipher.
These chemicals are very delicate. Please do not disturb me now.
